taskDescription: Carboxylic acids (RCO2H; pKa ≈ 5) are approximately 1011 times more acidic than alcohols (ROH; pKa ≈ 16). In other words, a carboxylate ion (RCO2−) is more stable than an alkoxide ion (RO−). Explain, using resonance.
